ETYMOLOGY: From Latin species 'appearance, form, kind', from specere 'to look, see'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A group of living organisms consisting of similar individuals capable of exchanging genes or interbreeding, and forming the basic unit of biological classification.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 生物分类学的基本单位，指一群能够相互交配并产生可育后代的相似个体。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: There are millions of different species of insects in the world.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 世界上有数百万种不同的昆虫。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A kind or sort of something.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His behavior was a strange species of politeness.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他的行为是一种奇怪的礼貌。
